items.summary: Democracies must be prepared to fight for freedom in order to survive, Nobel Peace Prize laureate and Venezuelan opposition leader MarÃ­a Corina Machado says.

items.title: Sophie Kinsella, author of the best-selling Shopaholic novels, dies at 55
items.summary: Kinsella, who also published under her real name, Madeleine Wickham, announced in April 2024 that she had been diagnosed in late 2022 with glioblastoma, an aggressive form of brain cancer.

items.title: Half a million people flee Thailandâ€“Cambodia border conflict as Trump moves to intervene again
items.summary: Thailand has rejected Donald Trump's plan to call both sides to achieve peace, with half a million people forced to flee the fighting along the border.

items.title: US plans to order foreign tourists, including Australians, to disclose social media histories
items.summary: Applicants would also have to submit phone numbers, email addresses, personal details of family members and biometric information under the plan.

items.title: Nearly 200 children conceived from sperm donor with increased cancer risk
items.summary: Between 2006 and 2022, the man's sperm was sold to 67 clinics in 14 countries, whereas 99 children were fathered by the donor in Denmark alone.

items.title: US backs Japan in dispute with China over radar incident as tensions escalate
items.summary: China and Japan have given differing accounts of the incident, which was a major escalation in tensions between the two nations.

items.title: Marco Rubio orders US State Department to revert to Times New Roman font, calling Calibri adoption 'wasteful'
items.summary: In a leaked internal cable, Secretary of State Marco Rubio calls the department's decision to adopt Calibri in 2023 a "wasteful" diversity move.

items.title: Australia records highest number of Indigenous deaths in custody since 1979
items.summary: Australia has recorded the highest number of Indigenous deaths in custody since 1979. Experts say over-incarceration remains a national crisis and prisons are neglecting the physical and mental health of vulnerable people.

items.title: Inquest into toddler's septic tank death sparks calls for improved maintenance in remote NT public housing
items.summary: Aboriginal housing advocates are calling for urgent improvements to the way remote public housing is maintained in the Northern Territory, after the coroner found the death of a toddler who fell into a backyard septic tank could have been prevented.

items.title: Climate crisis is threatening disabled Australians' access to nature
items.summary: From bushfires and decreasing air quality to flooding and erosion, climate change is threatening our relationship with nature, and people with disability are being disproportionately impacted.

items.title: North Melbourne expect to land former number one AFLW draft pick Kristie-Lee Weston-Turner
items.summary: North Melbourne have been unable to trade for Kristie-Lee Weston-Turner but the two-time defending AFLW premiers are still confident they'll secure the former number one draft pick.

items.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: New crocodile management plan draws mixed response in north Queensland
items.summary: The new management plan sees the expansion of crocodile removal zones across north and far north Queensland. Some say it will not increase safety without better community education.

items.title: New order banning supply of NSW North Coast green prawns a 'death knell' for industry
items.summary: White spot disease in prawns has led the NSW government to issue a new, five-year control order which will ban the sale of green prawns caught in affected waters.

items.title: Age verification errors see some under-16s retain access to banned social media platforms
items.summary: It's day one of the social media ban, but dozens of parents have told the ABC their children have already been able to get around the restrictions.

items.title: Hundreds of men march against domestic violence in Alice Springs on Human Rights Day
items.summary: Up to 300 men â€” and a similar number of women â€” have taken part in the annual Ingkintja Men's March Against Domestic Violence under the slogan End the silence! Stop the violence! in Alice Springs, coinciding with the International Human Rights Day.

items.title: Victim statements redacted in 2014 fatal SA freeway crash court hearing
items.summary: The daughters of a man who died in a truck crash at the bottom of the South-Eastern Freeway in 2014 have their heavily redacted victim impact statements read aloud in court, more than 11 years after their father died.

items.title: Halls Creek man arrested after allegedly selling $45k worth of alcohol in dry WA communities
items.summary: The man allegedly bought large quantities of beer, champagne and rum in Darwin before selling it in WA's Kimberley region.

items.title: Defence briefs Pacific nations on China's naval flotilla but 'final destination' unknown
items.summary: Australian Defence officials have been briefing Pacific nations about the formidable capabilities and weaponry of a Chinese naval flotilla in the region, which the ADF is continuing to monitor closely.

items.title: Children as young as 10 could be fitted with ankle monitors under proposed Queensland laws
items.summary: The legislation removes the requirement for either the child, or their parent or guardian, to consent to wearing the device.

items.title: Tasmania's bushfire danger arrived suddenly. Here's how to prepare
items.summary: Tasmania's bushfire season has suddenly arrived, with two catastrophes within days of each other. Here is how to prepare if one comes your way.

items.title: WA opposition blames police staffing levels for slow response to Boulder ambulance emergency
items.summary: The WA Liberals say a slow police response to a violent incident involving St John Ambulance officers in the Goldfields is due to understaffing but the claim has been rejected by the police minister.

items.title: Alex Volkanovski hoses down retirement rumours ahead of first UFC title defence on Australian soil
items.summary: Alex Volkanovski hoses down retirement rumours ahead of his first hometown fight in almost a decade with Australia's greatest ever UFC fighter aiming for another lengthy run defending the featherweight title.

items.title: To-do list, travel plans found during Luigi Mangione arrest revealed in court
items.summary: A to-do list and travel plans shed light on the steps the 27-year-old may have taken â€” or planned to take â€” to avoid capture after UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's killing last year.

items.title: From peacekeeping in Timor-Leste to PTSD in Afghanistan: The beauty and terror of being an official war artist
items.summary: Australia has been sending artists to the frontline since World War I, with more than 50 local artists taking part since then. But what's it actually like to head into war armed with a paintbrush?

items.title: Four more teenagers charged over stabbing at Ellenbrook Secondary College
items.summary: A 10th teenager is charged over an alleged premeditated gang attack at Ellenbrook Secondary College on Monday that left a student with stab wounds.

items.title: Melbourne nutrition influencer died from postpartum haemorrhage after freebirth, court hears
items.summary: A coroner's court has heard Melbourne nutrition influencer Stacey Warnecke died from a postpartum haemorrhage following a freebirth in September.

items.title: Taliban arrests young men in Afghanistan for Peaky Blinders dress-up
items.summary: Morality police in Afghanistan detain several influencers who have gone viral for dressing up as 1920s gangsters in the style of BBC series Peaky Blinders.

items.title: Timor-Leste remembers Indonesian invasion 50 years after military assault
items.summary: Survivors still have clear memories of the invasion by Indonesia, as Timor-Leste this week commemorates the beginning of a brutal 24-year occupation.

items.title: AI to be trialled at Royal Perth Hospital in bid to reduce pressure on WA health system
items.summary: A trial of artificial intelligence at Royal Perth Hospital is announced in an attempt to help health workers focus on patient care, as new data reveals WA's emergency departments are among the most stretched in the nation.

items.title: Mother whose son died after deliberately-lit house fire in Sydney says 'life is precious'
items.summary: The mother of a teenager who was killed in a deliberately-lit house fire has told a Sydney court her son taught her "life is so precious" and she longed to be with him again for the rest of her days.

items.title: Crucial koala corridors are dwindling in Sydney's south-west, conservationists warn
items.summary: Key wildlife links between two of Sydney's major rivers are under threat from land clearing for housing, according to a koala conservation group.

items.title: Testing on supermarket imported honey finds some is not all honey
items.summary: Australian beekeepers are funding their own investigation into the authenticity of imported honey, with tests showing other products are being added.

items.title: Man found 'hiding underwater' after Beenleigh fatal shooting charged with murder
items.summary: Police have charged 22-year-old Paul Tagirara over a fatal shooting in Beenleigh, south of Brisbane, earlier this month which claimed the life of a 35-year-old man.

items.title: Wells says 'gut reaction' to travel claims fair but she has 'upheld' rules
items.summary: Communications and Sports Minister Anika Wells accepts her taxpayer-funded travel claims have prompted a "gut reaction" in people.

items.title: Dancing gorilla wins Comedy Wildlife Photo Awards 2025
items.summary: The winning images pair talented nature photography with humour that often relies on capturing a moment at just the right time.

items.title: Union votes for correctional officers to continue strike, leaving prisoners in SA locked down indefinitely
items.summary: The union representing correctional officers has voted to strike indefinitely, while officers who monitor 1,500 people on home detention will stop work for 24 hours

items.title: In Data Dreams: Art and AI at the MCA, 10 artists explore the impact of AI on contemporary life
items.summary: Can you tell what's real and what's fake online? Data Dreams: Art and AI at the MCA, featuring a Kim Kardashian deepfake, looks at the impact of AI on everyday life

items.title: Sydney lawyer Sylvan Singh charged with alleged attempts to import drugs
items.summary: Solicitor Sylvan Singh, 26, is granted bail after being charged with four counts of attempting to import a commercial quantity of drugs.

items.title: Rare brain illness could not stop Milly from making country netball history
items.summary: A rare brain illness left Milly Brock unable to walk or speak, but eight months later, she was back leading her regional netball club on grand final day.

items.title: Tasmanian ministers access $45,000 in free NBL and AFL tickets in a year
items.summary: Tasmanian government ministers have accessed more than $21,000 of free tickets to Tasmania JackJumpers games in the past 12 months, available as part of an agreement with the basketball club.

items.title: Unknown number of homes and buildings destroyed in Capertee Valley bushfire
items.summary: An unknown number of unoccupied homes and buildings have been destroyed in a bushfire burning in NSW's Capertee Valley near Lithgow. A high fire danger warning remains in place with conditions expected to get worse.

items.title: Formal complaint filed to FIFA over Gianni Infantino's peace prize awarded to US president Donald Trump
items.summary: A human rights organisation files an official complaint to FIFA over its peace prize awarded to US President Donald Trump.

items.title: Hannah Wilson has quit medicinal cannabis but has been relentlessly targeted by advertisements
items.summary: Hannah Wilson says she found it shockingly easy to obtain a medicinal cannabis prescription, despite her history of schizophrenic psychosis.

items.title: Volunteer WA firefighter with rare and aggressive cancer calls for compensation
items.summary: Matthew Petch says firefighters like him are being left behind by an outdated compensation scheme and a lack of health screening.

items.title: Pet cam captures bull and horse sneaking into home of NT politician Andrew Mackay
items.summary: An NT resident tells of discovering he had unexpected guests in his home, after his dogs were filmed nudging open a door and letting inside a pet bull and horse.

items.title: 'Integrity' of environmental approvals questioned in WA government's attempt to balance nature and industry in new laws
items.summary: As WA's state development laws make their way through parliament, critics are worried about environmental approvals and concentration of power, but the government insists the changes mean more transparency.

items.title: Report finds 'shockingly low' government spend on preventing child removals
items.summary: Only 15.6 per cent of national child protection funding goes towards family support services aimed at keeping families intact, a report has found. Advocates are urging the government to "invest in families, not crisis".

items.title: South Africa dismissed for its lowest ever T20 score as India sends ominous message to rivals
items.summary: The rematch of last year's T20 World Cup final is dominated by India as South Africa is dismissed for just 74 runs.

items.title: Mayhem at Brisbane Lady Gaga concert as long queues blamed on 'technical issues'
items.summary: The stadium says "technical issues" identified during a sound check meant the gates did not open until 50 minutes later than scheduled, which caused long queues.

items.title: UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention denied visits to NT prisons, meetings with government
items.summary: The number of people in custody has surged dramatically in the Northern Territory since the government passed sweeping bail and justice reforms in 2024.

items.title: Why is Elon Musk fighting with the European Union over social media platform X?
items.summary: The latest target of Elon Musk's ire is the European Union, which he has called a "bureaucratic monster" that "should be abolished". So, what's going on?

items.title: US judge approves release of grand jury documents against Ghislaine Maxwell
items.summary: The judge grants the Justice Department's request under a new law requiring the release of files related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

items.title: Markets live: ASX falls and Wall Street cautious ahead of likely US rate cut decision â€” as it happened
items.summary: The Australian share market has fallen slightly on a mostly flat day, following a cautious performance on Wall Street as the US Federal Reserve decides whether to cut interest rates. Follow live.

items.title: Federal politics: Albanese says social media ban biggest 'cultural change' Australia has faced â€” as it happened
items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says Australia's social media ban will change lives as Australia takes "back control" from social media companies.

items.title: Ten-year-old snake bite survivor gives back to community through cow sale
items.summary: This 10-year-old is selling her family's cows to help raise funds for those who rescued her when she suffered a potentially deadly snake bite.

items.title: Aboriginal group left without legal recourse without federal human rights act
items.summary: Legal experts say Australia is lagging in its human rights approach and should adopt a federal human rights act.

items.title: Taronga Zoo to 'rewild' cleared farmland in northern NSW with native Australian animals
items.summary: Taronga Zoo has successfully bred native Australian animals for years â€” but it now has a vision on how to re-establish their populations.

items.title: Scorchers take aim at Sixers ahead of WBBL semifinal after eliminating Stars in knockout final
items.summary: The Perth Scorchers keep their WBBL title hopes alive with a win over the Stars in a knockout final, as youngster Chloe Ainsworth shows her credentials on the big stage.

items.title: NSW Police charge 19yo over alleged grenade, gunfire attack at Tallawong home
items.summary: A 19-year-old is expected to front court on Wednesday after been charged over the alleged shooting at a Tallawong home.

items.title: Abuse survivors say Centrelink's 'couple rule' puts women in danger
items.summary: Financial and domestic abuse survivors say the way Centrelink assesses benefit payments for people in a relationship makes it harder for women to leave dangerous relationships.

items.title: Widespread rain across NSW to reduce threat of bushfires leading up to Christmas
items.summary: The most widespread rain in three months will develop across New South Wales during the coming days, reducing the threat of bushfires in the lead-up to Christmas.

items.title: Gaza named deadliest place for journalists in 2025 RSF report on dangers facing media globally
items.summary: Gaza has been named the deadliest place in the world to work as a journalist by French-based press freedom advocates Reporters Without Borders.

items.title: Community comes together to send Christmas cards to South Australian prisoners
items.summary: Two Adelaide women have made it their mission to collect 2,000 Christmas cards for prisoners who'll spend this year's festive season behind bars.
